Module project.c482
Package project.c482

Class MainScreenController

java.lang.Object
project.c482.MainScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
MainScreenController class initialized. The MainScreenController class controls the functionality and features on MainScreen scene.

  • Method Details

    • clickPartAddButton

      public void clickPartAddButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      When the user clicks the Add button in the Part table, the following brings up the add part scene.
      Parameters:
      event - user clicks the add button.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FXMLLoader.

    • clickPartModifyButton

      public void clickPartModifyButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Similar to the Add part button above, if user clicks the Modify button in the Part table, the following brings up the Modify Part scene. Note: If user selects the Modify button before selecting a part, they will see an error message pop up prompting them to select a part to modify.
      Parameters:
      event - user clicks the modify button.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FXMLLoader.

    • clickPartDeleteButton

      public void clickPartDeleteButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Remove Part from Part table. 1. User first picks the part they wish to remove. 2. User then selects the Delete button. 3. User is prompted with a pop-up warning to confirm they wish to delete part. 4. Once user clicks "OK", Part is then deleted, otherwise if they select "cancel" the part and part table will remain unchanged. Note: If user clicks the Delete button before picking a part, they will see an error message pop up prompting them to pick a part to be deleted first.
      Parameters:
      event - user selects Delete button in the part table.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • searchBy_PartName_or_ID

      public void searchBy_PartName_or_ID(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Search Part by ID or partial or full name.
      Parameters:
      event - user presses the enter key on their keyboard to perform part search. 1. User types partial or full Part name, or Part ID, of the part they wish to search for in the "Search by Part ID or Name" text field in the Part table. 2. User presses the enter key on their keyboard. 3. If a match or multiple matches are found, then the matching search results are displayed. Note: If no matching search results are found, then a warning message box will display stating that there were no matching results found.

    • clickProductAddButton

      public void clickProductAddButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      When the user clicks the Modify button in the Product table, the following brings up add product scene.
      Parameters:
      event - user clicks the add button.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FMXLLoader.

    • clickProductModifyButton

      public void clickProductModifyButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Similar to the Add Product button above, if user clicks the Modify button in the Product table, the following brings up the Modify Product scene. Note: If user selects the Modify button before selecting a product, they will see an error message pop up prompting them to select a product to modify.
      Parameters:
      event - user clicks the modify button.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FMXLLoader.

    • clickProductDeleteButton

      public void clickProductDeleteButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Remove Product from Product table. 1. User first picks the product they wish to remove. 2. User then selects the Delete button. 3. User is prompted with a pop-up warning to confirm they wish to delete product. 4. Once user clicks "OK", product is then deleted, otherwise if they select "cancel" the product and product table will remain unchanged. Note: If user clicks the Delete button before picking a Product, or the product has associated part, they will see a pop-up error message.
      Parameters:
      event - user selects Delete button in the product table.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FMXLLoader.

    • searchBy_ProductName_or_ID

      public void searchBy_ProductName_or_ID(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Search Product by ID or partial or full name.
      Parameters:
      event - user presses the enter key on their keyboard to perform product search. 1. User types partial or full Product name, or Product ID, of the product they wish to search for in the "Search by Part ID or Name" text field in the Product table. 2. User presses the enter key on their keyboard. 3. If a match or multiple matches are found, then the matching search results are displayed. Note: If no matching search results are found, then a warning message box will display stating that there were no matching results were found.

    • clickExitButton

      public void clickExitButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Exits application if user clicks exit button.
      Parameters:
      event - user selects the exit button.
      Throws:
      IOException - from FXMLLoader.
